posts.content:
am in the process of fitting a 4" narrowed beam to my 63 split. i also have dropped spindles but there is a difference between them. as my bus is a 63 i know its a pain in the arse with parts being different.

this is the spindle on my bus


which i take it is 63 onwards making it a late

and the dropped spindle is this one

making it an early.

am i right in saying this?

as all my brake components are lates im assuming they will definately not fit the early spindle.
And VWJim says.....
Your right you have lates on your bus and the dropped are early.Brakes are different, where did you get the spindles from?
i thought as much. i got the spindles from a guy on vzi who does them, will just have to get in touch with him and send them back and send mine to, to be made in to dropped spindles.

Gnarly wrote:And VWJim says.....
me too late... must try harder next time...

Still make sure you get the right ones to fit your beam, you may have early link pins.
Jim am i right in saying there are two types of spindle for 63? what i would call normal 'earlies' and the other being late spindles with 24mm kingpins that use the early link pin size.
i am sending the ones i bought back to the guy i bought them off and am sending mine with them to have them made into dropped spindles at no extra cost. happy days

Rusting Hulk wrote:Still make sure you get the right ones to fit your beam, you may have early link pins.
Jim am i right in saying there are two types of spindle for 63? what i would call normal 'earlies' and the other being late spindles with 24mm kingpins that use the early link pin size.
Yep, I've come across them a few times. A real pain when you try and match parts.

vwjim wrote:
Rusting Hulk wrote:Still make sure you get the right ones to fit your beam, you may have early link pins.
Jim am i right in saying there are two types of spindle for 63? what i would call normal 'earlies' and the other being late spindles with 24mm kingpins that use the early link pin size.
Yep, I've come across them a few times. A real pain when you try and match parts.
ye it is a rite pain in the arse especially as i got a 63.
